remarks: Basic properties of the order isomorphism ` G ` used later.  The support of an ` F e. S ` is a finite subset of ` A ` , so it is well-ordered by ` _E ` and the order isomorphism has domain a finite ordinal.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 28-Jun-2019.)
statement:
cantnfs.s $e |- S = dom ( A CNF B ) $.
cantnfs.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. On ) $.
cantnfs.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. On ) $.
cantnfcl.g $e |- G = OrdIso ( _E , ( F supp (/) ) ) $.
cantnfcl.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. S ) $.
cantnfcl $p |- ( ph -> ( _E We ( F supp (/) ) /\ dom G e. _om ) ) $.
